noun.description: (in bridge, whist, and similar card games) a playing card of the suit chosen to rank above the others, which can win a trick where a card of a different suit has been led.

verb.description: (in bridge, whist, and similar card games) play a trump on (a card of another suit), having no cards of the suit led.

phrases: they've trumped up charges against her
Supporters said the charges against the activists were trumped up.
He has claimed the charges were trumped up to prevent him from challenging the former Prime Minister.
He had maintained that the charges were trumped up by the man and his cronies to prevent him from challenging the prime minister's rule.
He is serving a 15-year jail term for corruption and sodomy, charges he claims were trumped up to end his political career.
origin: Middle English: from Old French trompe, of Germanic origin; probably imitative.
